name: Roy Tang
text:
Most of the site uses a hand-rolled Python/Django backend. It is definitely not simple (see the About -> Site page for some details), but it works for me.

One thing about this site is all the content (including comments) are saved as markdown or json files in a public Github repository, so for the comments in particular, I can't ask for any private information like email addresses and that's also why I don't use any other auth system. One of the downsides is that there's no way to notify the commenter that there's a reply if the comment doesn't come in from another site via webmentions. Like this one! So IDK if you ever get to read this reply.

Incoming webmentions are processed from webmention.io
